app_dialog_welcome_message_info: This video will give you a brief introduction to token and N-gram analysis.
app_dialog_serverError_message: The followig Web-Server is under maintenance:
app_dialog_serverError_message_info: The API is currently unavailable. The server is undergoing maintenance. Please try again at a later time.
vizPanel_help_info: You can use the following visualizations - Depending on the selected visualization you will get different insights:
viz_name_timechart_info: The 'frequency over time'-view allows a very clear representation of all data. Several queries can be visualized in parallel. This allows you to compare several queries over time. Use the interactive options (e.g. select time period - below the graphic).
viz_name_calendar_info: The calendar view sums up all queries for the selected time period (granulation). This makes it easier to identify 'peeks' on specific days. Use the slider to narrow down the data - e.g. to identify HOT/COLD spots.
viz_name_sankey_info: The Sankey-view is especially suitable if you are interested in the identification of patterns in speech usage. The larger nodes/edges are displayed, the more frequent is the corresponding token (=node - at the position) or the corresponding transition (=edge - relation between two tokens/nodes).
vizPanel_help_additionalInfo: All visualizations are interactive. Move the mouse over interesting places in the graphic, to display detailed information.
vizOptions_help_info: In this area you can change the following options:
vizOption_name_frequency_info: The 'Relative frequency' is always activated by default (blue - dot on the right). When 'Relative Frequency' is active, the frequency is displayed in 'per million'. The 'Relative frequency' always refers to the sum of all 'N' that lie in the selected time period (see 'Granulation'). If 'Relative Frequency' is deactivated, the absolute frequency is displayed - therefore, every occurrence of 'N' in the time period is counted without a reference value.
vizOption_name_granulation_info: The granulation specifies the time period that is taken, to sum up the frequency.
vizOption_name_granulation_info_ext: Depending on the granulation, different smoothing settings are available (see 'Smoothing').
vizOption_name_smoothing_info: If a smoothing is greater than 1, the data will be smoothed using a moving average. If the value is 1, no smoothing is applied.
vizOption_name_smoothing_info_ext: Depending on the granulation, different smoothing settings are available (see 'Granulation'). On the scale, the most prominent smoothing values are displayed.

PWSsubstituting interrogative pronounwer, was

PAVpronominal adverbdafür, dabei, deswegen, trotzdem
PTKZU"zu" before an infinitive zu [gehen]
PTKNEGnegation particlenicht
PTKVZseparated verbal particle[er kommt] an, [er fährt] rad
PTKANTanswer particle ja, nein, danke, bitte
PTKAparticle with adjective or adverbam [schönsten], zu [schnell]
TRUNCparticle with adjective or adverbAn- [und Abreise]
VVFINfinite content verb [du] gehst, [wir] kommen [an]
VVIMPimperative content verbkomm [!]
VVINFinfinitive of content verbgehen, ankommen
VVIZUinfinitive of content verb with "zu" anzukommen, loszulassen
VVPPpast participle of content verbgegangen, angekommen
VAFINpast participle of content verb[du] bist, [wir] werden
VAIMPimperativ, primary auxiliarysei [ruhig !]
VAINFinfinitive, primary auxiliarywerden, sein
VAPPpast partiple, primary auxiliarygewesen

VMINFinfinitive, modal auxiliary wollen
VMPPpast participle, modal auxiliarygekonnt, [er hat gehen] können
XYnon-word, containing special charactersnd3:7, H2O, D2XW3
$,comma ,
$.punctuation at end of sentence. ? ! ; :
$(other punctuation, sentence internal- [,]()
search_simple_help_info:
The "Simple Search" for N-grams includes the following features:

  • Different N-gram lengths from 1 to 3
    e. g.. N=1: Virus, N=2: zweite Welle, N=3: Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel
  • N-Gram Search
    bayer (exact match), bayer* (prefix - e. g. bayern), *bayer (suffix - e. g. nordbayer)
    or *bayer* (random position - e. g. nordbayern)
  • Different annotation layers
    Word-Form, Lemma or POS (Part-of-Speech).
    e. g.: 2-Gram: ADJ* Merkel, 3-Gram: ART unglaublich NN

Hint: Queries and results are always reduced to lower case.
search_complex_help_info:
The "Advanced in-depth Search" offers the following additional features
(For basic functions see: "Simple search"):

  • Simultaneous searches on multiple annotation levels
    Word-Form and/or Lemma and/or POS (Part-of-Speech)
    e. g.: 1-Gram: 1. Lemma = gut* & 1. POS = ADJ*
    e. g.: 2-Gram: 1. Lemma = gefährlich & 2. Lemma = Virus & 2. POS = NN

Hint: Queries and results are always reduced to lower case.
search_ruleError_01: Only one token is allowed per search field. If you want to search for N-grams, increase the search window size - e. g. to N=2 or N=3 (see above)
search_ruleError_02: You can use a maximum of two * per search field.
search_ruleError_03: Please use only '*' instead of '.*'. - OWIDplusLIVE only supports simple queries.
search_error_notEmpty: The field may not be empty.
clipboard_head: SEARCH-HISTORY: Compare & refine your previous searches
clipboard_help_head: HELP: Compare & refine your previous searches
clipboard_help_info_intro: In the section 'Compare & refine previous searches' you can choose from the following features:
clipboard_help_info_compare:
Compare searches
If you run several searches in a row, the results are archived here and displayed in detail.
clipboard_help_info_detail:
Refine searches and detail view
The detailed view shows exactly which time series have been summarized in a search result. You can select or deselect individual time series. This allows you to filter out strong outliers or unwanted results.
clipboard_help_info_saveLoad:
Save and load full search history
You can save the entire search history. The search history is archived as a JSON object on your hard disk. This allows you to reload all data at any time. You can share the data (e.g. with a seminar group) and also modify the data afterwards (e.g. choose a different smoothing or granulation).
clipboard_help_info_export:
Export search results
If you click on the three-dot menu of a single search, you can export this search. The following export formats are available:
  • Link: A link is created, which can be used to call up the search directly (no extra input required). This is useful, for example, if you want to share a search with others or if you want to repeat the search at regular intervals.
  • TSV: Creates a TSV table. This table can be opened in Excel or another spreadsheet program, for example.
  • JSON: A JSON object is especially suitable for further processing with self-written programs and scripts.
